message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.OH, cs.MM, cs.SD

The paper discusses a novel imaging architecture that improves the measurement rate of spatial multiplexing cameras (SMC) by replacing the photodetector with a 1D linear array or a line-sensor. This involves compressive sensing techniques and information theory (cs.IT), computer vision (cs.CV), and multimedia (cs.MM) to achieve high-resolution imaging at video rate. The paper also discusses the optical architecture underlying LiSens, which falls under optics (cs.OH) and signal processing (cs.SD).
